verses.verse: Behold <S%H4428><s%>, a king shall reign <S%H4427><s%> in righteousness <S%H6664><s%>, and princes <S%H8269><s%> shall rule <S%H8323><s%> in justice <S%H4941><s%>.

And a man <S%H376><s%> shall be as a hiding-place <S%H4224><s%> from the wind <S%H7307><s%>, and a covert <S%H5643><s%> from the tempest <S%H2230><s%>, as streams <S%H6388><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> in a dry place <S%H6724><s%>, as the shade <S%H6738><s%> of a great <S%H3515><s%> rock <S%H5553><s%> in a weary <S%H5889><s%> land <S%H776><s%>.
And the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of them that see <S%H7200><s%> shall not be dim <S%H8159><s%>, and the ears <S%H241><s%> of them that hear <S%H8085><s%> shall hearken <S%H7181><s%>.

And the heart <S%H3824><s%> of the rash <S%H4116><s%> shall understand <S%H995><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, and the tongue <S%H3956><s%> of the stammerers <S%H5926><s%> shall be ready <S%H4116><s%> to speak <S%H1696><s%> plainly <S%H6703><s%>.
The fool <S%H5036><s%> shall be no more called <S%H7121><s%> noble <S%H5081><s%>, nor the churl <S%H3596><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to be bountiful <S%H7771><s%>.

For the fool <S%H5036><s%> will speak <S%H1696><s%> folly <S%H5039><s%>, and his heart <S%H3820><s%> will work <S%H6213><s%> iniquity <S%H205><s%>, to practise <S%H6213><s%> profaneness <S%H2612><s%>, and to utter <S%H1696><s%> error <S%H8442><s%> against Jehovah <S%H3068><s%>, to make empty <S%H7324><s%> the soul <S%H5315><s%> of the hungry <S%H7457><s%>, and to cause the drink <S%H4945><s%> of the thirsty <S%H6771><s%> to fail <S%H2637><s%>.

And the instruments <S%H3627><s%> of the churl <S%H3596><s%> are evil <S%H7451><s%>: he deviseth <S%H3289><s%> wicked devices <S%H2154><s%> to destroy <S%H2254><s%> the meek <S%H6041><s%> with lying <S%H8267><s%> words <S%H561><s%>, even when the needy <S%H34><s%> speaketh <S%H1696><s%> right <S%H4941><s%>.
But the noble <S%H5081><s%> deviseth <S%H3289><s%> noble <S%H5081><s%> things <S%H5081><s%>; and in noble things shall he continue <S%H5081><s%>.

Rise up <S%H6965><s%>, ye women <S%H802><s%> that are at ease <S%H7600><s%>, and hear <S%H8085><s%> my voice <S%H6963><s%>; ye careless <S%H982><s%> daughters <S%H1323><s%>, give ear <S%H238><s%> unto my speech <S%H565><s%>.

For days <S%H3117><s%> beyond a year <S%H8141><s%> shall ye be troubled <S%H7264><s%>, ye careless women <S%H982><s%>; for the vintage <S%H1210><s%> shall fail <S%H3615><s%>, the ingathering <S%H625><s%> shall not come <S%H935><s%>.

Tremble <S%H2729><s%>, ye women that are at ease <S%H7600><s%>; be troubled <S%H7264><s%>, ye careless ones <S%H982><s%>; strip <S%H6584><s%> you <S%H6209><s%>, and make you bare, and gird <S%H2290><s%> sackcloth upon your loins <S%H2504><s%>.
They shall smite <S%H5594><s%> upon the breasts <S%H7699><s%> for the pleasant <S%H2531><s%> fields <S%H7704><s%>, for the fruitful <S%H6509><s%> vine <S%H1612><s%>.

Upon the land <S%H127><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> shall come up <S%H5927><s%> thorns <S%H6975><s%> and briers <S%H8068><s%>; yea <S%H1004><s%>, upon all the houses of joy <S%H4885><s%> in the joyous <S%H5947><s%> city <S%H7151><s%>.

For the palace <S%H759><s%> shall be forsaken <S%H5203><s%>; the populous <S%H1995><s%> city <S%H5892><s%> shall be deserted <S%H5800><s%>; the hill <S%H6076><s%> and the watch-tower <S%H975><s%> shall be for dens <S%H4631><s%> for <S%H5704><s%> ever <S%H5769><s%>, a joy <S%H4885><s%> of wild asses <S%H6501><s%>, a pasture <S%H4829><s%> of flocks <S%H5739><s%>;

until the Spirit <S%H7307><s%> be poured <S%H6168><s%> upon us from on high <S%H4791><s%>, and the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> become a fruitful field <S%H3759><s%>, and the fruitful field <S%H3759><s%> be esteemed <S%H2803><s%> as a forest <S%H3293><s%>.
Then justice <S%H4941><s%> shall dwell <S%H7931><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>; and righteousness <S%H6666><s%> shall abide <S%H3427><s%> in the fruitful field <S%H3759><s%>.

And the work <S%H4639><s%> of righteousness <S%H6666><s%> shall be peace <S%H7965><s%>; and the effect <S%H5656><s%> of righteousness <S%H6666><s%>, quietness <S%H8252><s%> and confidence <S%H983><s%> for <S%H5704><s%> ever <S%H5769><s%>.

And my people <S%H5971><s%> shall abide <S%H3427><s%> in a peaceable <S%H7965><s%> habitation <S%H5116><s%>, and in safe <S%H4009><s%> dwellings <S%H4908><s%>, and in quiet <S%H7600><s%> resting-places <S%H4496><s%>.
But it shall hail <S%H1258><s%> in the downfall <S%H3381><s%> of the forest <S%H3293><s%>; and the city <S%H5892><s%> shall be utterly <S%H8213><s%> laid low <S%H8213><s%>.
Blessed <S%H835><s%> are yet that sow <S%H2232><s%> beside all waters <S%H4325><s%>, that send forth <S%H7971><s%> the feet <S%H7272><s%> of the ox <S%H7794><s%> and the ass <S%H2543><s%>.
